message.content:
cs.NI, cs.GT, cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.DC 

This paper deals with resource allocation and auction mechanisms in cognitive networks, which are typically studied in the computer networks (cs.NI) and game theory (cs.GT) sub-categories. The paper also discusses the design of a bidding language, which involves information theory (cs.IT) concepts. Additionally, the paper addresses security and privacy issues in the auction mechanisms, which are relevant to the cryptography and security (cs.CR) sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes a framework for joint resource bidding and tipping, which involves distributed computing (cs.DC) concepts.
